comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; WOW64; rv:2.0b12) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b12
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; WOW64; rv:2.0b12) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b12

This never happened before this week. Now, with either Firefox (Beta 4.12 or 3.6.12) I am unable to check my upload speed at either http://www.bandwidthplace.com/  or http://www.speedtest.net/  I have screenshots of the errors. Biut with both Chrome and Explorer, it works fine.

Reproducible: Always



Expected Results:  
I should have received my upload speed.

comments.creator: jo.hermans@gmail.com
comments.text: You need to clear your cache before you start the test. Easiest way is to go to the websites, and then reload with the shift key pressed in (or ctrl-shift-r). If you don't do it you can get strange results, but I've also seen it with this error message. Your cache seems to remember that downloaded file, which creates a problem in the flash applet.
comments.raw_text: You need to clear your cache before you start the test. Easiest way is to go to the websites, and then reload with the shift key pressed in (or ctrl-shift-r). If you don't do it you can get strange results, but I've also seen it with this error message. Your cache seems to remember that downloaded file, which creates a problem in the flash applet.
comments.author: jo.hermans@gmail.com
mrzonacat@gmail.com
comments.creator: mrzonacat@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Thanks. This worked the first time. But on a few other occasions, it even happened during the download speed test. The strange thing is that I have had various versions of Firefox over the years and this has never happened before. It also happens on all users as of late. On one other occasion when it happeneed, it said something about "not authenticated" but I forgot to take a screenshot so I do not recall the exact error message. I will be more aware of why these glitches are suddenly happening only to Firefox and I will save all subsequent error message.

comments.text:
This is WFM with Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110513 Firefox/6.0a1 ID:20110513214941 & Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1 ID:20110413222027.

Maybe Site Issues with JS-Libraries (there Warnings concerning undeclared Variables in Error Console listed) and/or Extension blocking some Stuff?
